sub_title: Senior Consultant Health and Life Sciences
summary:
Writer and senior consultant in health & life sciences and science & technology. 

Current and recent work:

- proposal writing and consortia development across innovations in health, life sciences, technology, pharmaceutical and medical devices. Grant writing, research, project management and provision of expert advice on major European Commission, global and national funding schemes including EIC Accelerator, EIC Pathfinder and a wide variety of Horizon Europe subsidy and grant calls

- online program management for EU Member State health experts on three European Commission programs for DG SANTE, including Mission Cancer (Horizon Europe); Health Data and the GDPR (for CHAFEA); and the Steering Group of the Health Promotion, Disease Prevention and Management of Non-Communicable Diseases program 

- grant and project management including medical writing, research, gap analyses, needs assessments, medcomms, grants, funding proposal and RFP writing in health, pharmaceutical and medical education 

- writing and ghostwriting articles on science and technology topics for various online journals 

- research, proposal writing and editing in public health and international development 

Feel free to connect!

treasury_media.title: Family Secrets, Secret Families research project
treasury_media.description: I’m writing a book using data collected for my PhD research project: Family Secrets, Secret Families. Get in touch with me if you'd like to share your own family secret via katy.greenland@gmail.com

authors.headline: Senior Consultant Health and Life Sciences

profile_positions.description: Proposal writing and consortia development across innovations in health, life sciences, technology, pharmaceutical and medical devices. Grant writing, research, project management and provision of expert advice and review on major European Commission funding schemes including EIC Accelerator, EIC Pathfinder and a range of Horizon Europe subsidy and grant calls.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant

profile_positions.description: Freelance writing and consultancy in the health, medical, pharmaceutical and science sectors. Consultancy clients include the European Commission, the Netherlands Institute for Health Services Research (Nivel), and ResultsInHealth. Freelance writing work for a range of online journals including GIM International and Hydro International.
profile_positions.title: Writer and Researcher

company.name: Department of Health & Human Services, Victoria

profile_positions.description:
Family Safety Victoria
Responsible for leading, planning, and contributing to projects addressing family violence. 

•	Provision of advice and recommendations around complex family violence issues 
•	Project management of major statewide cross-sector initiatives including across the mental health and drug and alcohol sectors
•	Organising and facilitating metropolitan and regional stakeholder consultations 
•	Contribution to major service system reforms, including the redevelopment of the family violence risk assessment and management and the amendment of the Family Violence Protection Act
•	Undertaking work on the planning and implementation of the new family violence information sharing regime 
•	Monitoring and reporting on family violence issues, risks and trends  
•	Preparation and presentation of reports and briefings
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Officer

profile_positions.description:
Centre for Victorian Data Linkages
•	Development of a Stakeholder Engagement Strategy 
•	Provision of advice on complex research and data matters to internal and external stakeholders 
•	Preparation and presentation of detailed reports, ministerial briefs, cabinet and agency submissions 
•	Knowledge and application of privacy principles, health information principles, research ethics guidelines, and related legislation within a data linkage and research data context
•	Project management of over 25 research data linkage projects, supporting projects from initial enquiry through ethics and data custodian approvals, advising on research design
•	Data analysis to support coordination, reporting processes and outcomes of data linkage including descriptive data analyses and reports for both internal purposes and as an advocacy tool
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Officer, Research Data and Integration

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for coordinating research publications, researcher profiles, research ethics and grants for the Faculty of the VCA & MCM (now called the Faculty of the Fine Arts and Music) at The University of Melbourne. Some of my responsibilities included: 
•	Coordination of the annual University publications collection for the Faculty 
•	Chair, The University of Melbourne Ethics Administrator’s Network
•	Coordination of major University and external research funding schemes including budget and application development, review and international project team management 
•	Coordinating major multi-year Australian Research Council research funding applications (awarded over $1.1million in one year alone and a 60% success rate, in the context of a 16% success rate nationally)
•	Management and promotion of departmental grant funding streams 
•	Developing a major new Research Publications Collections Process for the Faculty including consultation, promotion and delivery
•	Writing high level reports for the University on research management matters
•	Chair, The University of Melbourne Ethics Administrator’s Network
•	Development and delivery of a research ethics and cultural competency training program across the Faculty including working with the Wilin Centre for Indigenous Art and Culture
•	Developing a major new Research Publications Collections Process for the Faculty including consultation, promotion and delivery
•	Coordination of the Faculty’s researcher profiles across a number of systems
profile_positions.title: Research Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
A social policy analysis and development role within the Social Development department for local government. 
•	Consultation with community groups to identify needs, issues and trends
•	Development of shared community facilities policy guidelines and gambling policy
•	Preparation of reports and briefing papers for executive management and Council
•	Provision of social planning advice and support to assist other areas of Council and community organisations in the municipality to enhance community wellbeing
•	Coordination of local advocacy networks
profile_positions.title: Social Policy and Planning Officer

profile_positions.description:
•	Carer work in Neuro-Psychiatric Rehabilitation in the Brain Disorders Program with people with Acquired Brain Injury (ABI) and a mental illness or psychiatric disorder
•	Therapy, nursing and care work with people with ABI, Schizophrenia, Depression, Dementia, Bipolar, Post Traumatic Stress Disorder and Huntington’s Disease
profile_positions.title: Psychiatric Services Officer, Brain Disorders Unit, Royal Talbot

profile_positions.description: •	Applied Behavioural Analysis therapy and in-home support with Autism clients
profile_positions.title: Support Worker

volunteer_experiences.description: I founded and ran the Shut Up & Write chapter in Amsterdam, hosting a weekly writer's group at a beautiful bookstore in the centre of Amsterdam.

company.name: Laugh or Cry Women's Support Circle

volunteer_experiences.description: Support group specifically for women, addressing the full range of issues experienced, operating flexibly both in person and remotely. Co-founded with Alex Baker.

Peer reviewer for a number of journals including Sociological Research Online, Societies, Behavioural Science, International Journal of Environmental Research and Public Health, Cultivate, and Genealogy.
Contributed to the work of the Group to advocate for the advancement of science, research and innovation in Europe.

Board member at Alleviate, a grassroots organisation founded in Amsterdam that undertakes projects addressing poverty with a particular focus on health and nutrition as well as material aid for individuals and groups experiencing poverty, inequality and injustice. My main responsibilities were strategic and organisational development as well as research, writing and advocacy.
